text.tspan: The patient presents with a chief complaint of persistent cough
and fatigue, ongoing for the past 5 days. The cough is described
as dry and non-productive, worsening at night. Fatigue is reported
as moderate and interfering with daily activities. The patient
denies fever, chills, or shortness of breath. Sleep has been
disrupted due to coughing fits. The patient notes increased stress
levels due to an upcoming work deadline. There are no reported
changes in chronic conditions or medications. Overall, the patient
appears fatigued but is able to provide a clear history of the
